p: In the dry season, TSS level was strongly predicted by river height lagged 4 weeks, which had a negative coefficient ( Fig 3C.1). Lastly, minimum temperature lagged 0 and 4 weeks and river height lagged 4 weeks were important predictors of TSS in the wet season. Minimum temperature at both lags had a positive association with TSS, and river height had a negative association ( Fig 3C.2).
